•   We will not include the deferred income taxes as a component of the net deferred income taxes as of the beginning of the period.

Other factors leading to the lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in 2019 included:
• The timing of the roll-out of 5G technology and the decision to devote limited capital to expanding our fixed WTTPs to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, as well as to expanding fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses
• The continued development of our wireless and wireline networks, as we continue to increase capacity, improve coverage, and provide access to high-speed data services
• The continued focus of our investments on the deployment of fixed WTTPs to rural locations, as well as on expanding fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses
results.csv_string_response:
Our 2019 capital expenditures were impacted by:
• Lower capital expenditures in our wireless segment of $3 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology
• A modest reduction in capital expenditures in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media of $6 million in 2019, compared to 2018, mainly due to production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018

The increase was primarily driven by a $3.1 million increase in gross margin driven by higher net sales, as well as the benefit of completed restructuring activities. The improvement was partially offset by a $2.4 million increase in SG&A expenses, a $1.4 million increase in R&D expenses, and a $0.6 million increase in restructuring charges.
